snippet: The Bloomberg administration should drop the requirement that all applicants for food stamps be electronically fingerprinted, which leads too many New Yorkers to forgo help.
abstract: Editorial argues that New York City Mayor Michael Bloomberg's administration should stop requiring that food stamp recipients be fingerprinted; asserts that the practice is stigmatizing and leads to too many New Yorkers foregoing the help they need.
lead_paragraph: The Bloomberg administration should drop the requirement that all applicants for food stamps be electronically fingerprinted, which leads too many New Yorkers to forgo help.
